titleInfo.title: USA v. Prorok
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 42 the Motion to Review detention and request for hearing. Defendant shall be released from the custody of the United States marshal to a member of the Federal Public Defender's office for transporation directly to the NOVA inpatient substance abuse treatment program. Said release shall occur upon the notification to the United States Marshal that a bed is currently available for defendant at said treatment program. Defendant shall immediately report to the United States Probation Office in Omaha, NE, upon his successful or unsuccessful discharge from the NOVA program; All other conditions of defendant's supervised release, not inconsistent with this order, shall remain in force and effect as to Charles Prorok (1). Signed by Judge Lyle E. Strom on 7/13/2006. 1 cert to USM (MKR, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

Defendant shall immediately report to the United States Probation Office in Omaha, NE, upon his successful or unsuccessful discharge from the NOVA program; All other conditions of defendant's supervised release, not inconsistent with this order, shall remain in force and effect as to Charles Prorok (1). Signed by Judge Lyle E. Strom on 7/13/2006. 1 cert to USM (MKR, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Prorok
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER ON REVOCATION OF SUPERVISED RELEASE that the supervised release of the defendant is hereby revoked. The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 27 months. The court directs the Bureau of Prisons to require the defendant to participate in the 500 hour comprehensive drug treatment program and further recommends that the defendant be incarcerated in a federal facility as close to the Federal District of Nebraska as possible as to defendant Charles Prorok Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom.(MKR )4 cert to USM
